wikipedia_page.main: Derek Edwards (birth unknown – 27 January 2020) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1960s and 1970s. He played at representative level for Great Britain and Yorkshire, and at club level for Castleford (Heritage № 458) and Keighley, as a fullback.

response: Derek Edwards (born 1958) is a Canadian stand-up comedian and actor from Timmins, Ontario. He went to Timmins High and Vocational School.
*MacPherson, Guy. "Derek Edwards takes standup to next stage." Vancouver Sun. May 31, 2007.
*Derek Edwards (rugby league) (flourished 1960s-1970s, died 2020), English rugby league footballer
*Derek Edwards (born 1958), Canadian stand-up comedian and actor

He was also selected for the Great Britain squad whilst at Hull Kingston Rovers for the 1968 Rugby League World Cup in Australia and New Zealand. However, along with Derek Edwards of Castleford, he did not participate in any of the three matches.
